title: Illuminated Manuscripts on the radio
content:
May seem a bit strange to talk about illuminated manuscripts on the radio, but [Forum](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201213758/http:/www.kqed.org/programs/program-archive.jsp?progID=RD19&ResultStart=1&ResultCount=10&type=radio), my local public radio talk show managed to do so for an hour. This was brought about by an exhibit at the Legion of Honor in San Francisco.   
   
Scroll down to the July 1st show and you can listen to the archive.   
   
Wanna find out more about the exhibit, here's the [Legion of Honor site](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201213758/http:/www.thinker.org/legion/exhibitions/exhibition.asp?exhibitionkey=252)   
   
I assume the radio show was \*ahem\* illuminating as it frequently is, but I was a bit preoccupied when I heard it live so will have to follow the link myself and give it another listen.   
   
Haven't seen the show yet, but I plan to (I've got until August)

 [‹ Looking for a Renaissance font](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201213758/http:/www.typophile.com/node/500 "Go to previous forum topic") [Book on Grids? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201213758/http:/www.typophile.com/node/514 "Go to next forum topic")
author: roballoo
